label: AB_mP16_4_4a_4a-001
title: $\alpha$-BiPd Structure
comments:
This is the room-temperature structure of BiPd.  Above 210$^\circ$C it transforms into the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_oC32_36_2ab_2ab-001}{orthorhombic $\beta$-BiPd structure} (Bhatt, 1979). 
 (Bhatt, 1979) gave the crystal structure in the \href{http://img.chem.ucl.ac.uk/sgp/large/004dy1.htm}{$B2_{1}$ setting of space group \#4}, which doubles the size of the primitive monoclinic cell but makes the resulting unit cell nearly orthorhombic.  We used FINDSYM to transform this to the standard $P2_{1}$ setting. 
 Space group $P2_{1}$ \#4 allows an arbitrary definition of the origin of the $y$-axis.  Here we follow (Bhatt, 1979) and set $y_{1} = 0$ for the first bismuth atom, Bi I.
